result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy Lisa Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete training and programming as assigned by the agent.  

Parties stipulate to 88 days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy Lisa Hoffman

defendant.name: Hoffman, Tammy Lisa
defendant.address: 153 N. Main St., #2, c/o James Grove, Richland Center, WI 53581

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Suzanne Edwards in court for Defendant Tammy Lisa Hoffman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. The DA moves to amend the charge to 3 counts of 946.41(1)resisting/obstructing and will file an amended complaint later today.  Court allows the amendment.  Def pleads NC to the three charges.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Sentencing: withhold sentence for 2 year probation on all 3 counts, concurrent.  Conditions; attend, pay for and successfully complete training and programs assigned by agent, pay costs of action, DNA sample and surcharge. Parties stipulate to 88 days credit in the event of revocation.

ADDRESS INFO for Tammy Lisa Hoffman
Current: 153 N. Main St., #2, c/o James Grove, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2016)
Prior: 552 W. Exchange Street, Lone Rock, WI 53556
Status conference on May 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Bond modified from cash to signature with the following conditions:  Defendant to remain at the home of JG at 153 N. Main St., #2, Richland Center, except for court, church, and medical appointments.  The no contact condition of the original bond - no contact with SS - remains in effect.

Defendant Tammy Lisa Hoffman in court, in custody, with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states that not all of the reports have been received in this matter; waiting for additional information before moving forward.  Atty. E - defense motions for amendment of the 20k cash bond to a signature bond with condition that she remain at the home of JG at 153 N. Main St., #2, Richland Center, except for court and church.  DA concurs; also asks conditions of the original bond to carry over.  Court orders 20k signature bond - no contact with SS, with condition that def remain at the home of JG except for court and church.  Status requested and set for 5-17 at 11.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Tammy Lisa Hoffman in court, in custody, with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states that the parties are working towards resolution; def will be waiving her right to prelim; ask for dispo scheduling this Friday.  Court informs counsel that the courthouse is not open this Friday.  Court accepts written prelim waiver and conducts waiver colloquy with the def.  Waiver accepted; def boundover for trial.  Court sets 4/7 at 2 for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defense counsel requests matter be reset to 1:30 on 03/02/16 rather than 10:00 a.m. No objection by DA.

Defendant Tammy Lisa Hoffman in court, in custody, with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Edwards states Defense has received the complaint; waives formal reading.  Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as her rights including right to prelim.  Atty. Edwards states def will waive the time limits for the prelim, preserving right to have one at a later date.  Court accepts time limits waiver and sets status/adj. initial.  Atty. E requests modification of bond.  Request denied.  Bond remains the same.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tammy Lisa Hoffman in court, in custody, with Atty. Lisa McDougal. (Atty. M states she is only make this appearance; not assigned to this def) Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def is presently on 20k cash bond.  Atty. M requests modification of bond to allow for def's release  Def addresses Court re bond; states she needs to be able to get out to pick up prescription and for employment reasons.  DA objects to modification of bond.  Court denies request for modification of bond and further adjourns this matter to later this week.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
